info.title: gateway-ocpi-service
info.description: A service to integrate customers according to OCPI e.g. charging stations, sessions, etc.

tags.name: CDR Module
tags.description: Serves to retrieve details of charging transactions (finished charging session). The CDR object is owned by the CPO backend system and can be pulled or pushed from CPO to eMSP.

tags.name: Credentials Module
tags.description: The credentials module is used to exchange the credentials token that has to be used by parties for authorization of requests.

tags.name: Tariffs Module
tags.description: The tariffs module gives eMSPs information about the tariffs used by the CPO. The Tariffs objects live in the CPO backend system.

tags.name: Platform
tags.description: CRUD functionality for the platform entity.

tags.name: Locations Module
tags.description: Serves to retrieve charging stations. The location objects live in the CPO backend system. They describe the charging locations of an operator.

tags.name: Versions Module
tags.description: Via this module, clients can learn which versions of OCPI a server supports, and which modules it supports for each of the versions.

tags.name: Customer Url Info.
tags.description: CRUD functionality for the customer url info.

tags.name: Sessions Module
tags.description: The session object describes one charging session. The session object is owned by the CPO backend system.

tags.name: Tokens Module
tags.description: The tokens module gives CPOs knowledge of the token information of an eMSP. The token objects live in the eMSP backend system.

tags.name: Commands Module
tags.description:
The Commands module enables remote commands to be sent to a Location/EVSE.
The following commands are supported:
CANCEL_RESERVATION, RESERVE_NOW, START_SESSION, STOP_SESSION

put.summary: Push new/updated Token object to the CPO.
put.description: New or updated Token objects are pushed from the eMSP to the CPO.

401.description: Unauthorized, if the provided authorization token is not valid

404.description: Server no matching endpoints with status error code: 3003

500.description: Generic server error with status error code: 3000

put.description: Create a Session if not exist, or update if exists. That session object is pushed from CPO to the eMSP.

401.description: Unauthorized, if the provided authorization token is not valid

404.description: OCPI Token does not exists with status error code: 2911

put.description: Update an existing customer url info.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Url value

parameters.description: Url value

parameters.description: Url value

put.summary: The CPO forwards a Location object update request to the eMSP.
put.description: Creates or updates a Location in eMSP.

401.description: Unauthorized, token does not exists: 2909

404.description: Server no matching endpoints: 3003

patch.summary: Notify the eMSP of partial updates of a Location (such as the status).
patch.description: Partial updates of the Location object.

put.summary: The CPO forwards a EVSE object update request to the eMSP.
put.description: Creates or updates a EVSE in eMSP.

401.description: Unauthorized, token does not exists: 2909

404.description: Server no matching endpoints: 3003

patch.summary: Notify the eMSP of partial updates of a EVSE (such as the status).
patch.description: Partial updates of the EVSE object.

put.summary: The CPO forwards a Connector object update request to the eMSP.
put.description: Creates or updates a Connector in eMSP.

401.description: Unauthorized, token does not exists: 2909

404.description: Server no matching endpoints: 3003

patch.summary: Notify the eMSP of partial updates of a Connector (such as the status).
patch.description: Partial updates of the Connector object.

put.summary: Updates Credentials and returns a new valid Token C for the specific OCPI version.
put.description: Updates and stores Token C for the available OCPI version with the sender.

400.description: Client not enough information with status error code: 2002

401.description: Unauthorized, if the provided authorization token is not valid

404.description: Server no matching endpoints with status error code: 3003

405.description: Client has not been registered with status error code: 2904

400.description: Server unsupported version with status error code: 3002
Bad Request while trying to save the platform entity

post.description: Creates and stores Token C for the available OCPI version with the sender.

404.description: Server no matching endpoints with status error code: 3003

405.description: Client has already been registered with status error code: 2901

400.description: Server unsupported version with status error code: 3002
Bad Request while trying to save the platform entity

post.description: Do a 'real-time' authorization request, validating if a Token might be used (at the optionally given Location).

schema.description:
The type of token *

* NOTE: The eMSP is RECOMMENDED to push Tokens with type: AD_HOC_USER or APP_USER with whitelist set to * NEVER. Whitelists are very useful for RFID type Tokens, but the AD_HOC_USER/APP_USER Tokens are used to * start Sessions from an App etc. so whitelisting them has no advantages. *

401.description: Unauthorized, if the provided country code and party id are not known

404.description: Not Found if token endpoint is not provided
Client Unknown location token with status code 2004

post.summary: Create list of customer url info.
post.description: Create list of customer url info like end-point url, module identifier and interface role.

409.description: Conflict, one of the URL(s) already exists

delete.summary: Delete all from customer url info entity.
delete.description: Delete all from customer url info entity like end-point url, module identifier and interface role.

post.description: Receives the command result from CPO and transmits it to the eMSP system.

get.description: Fetch CDRs from the CPOs system.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Only transactions which are linked to sessions started since this timestamp will be returned.

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Only transactions which are linked to sessions started before this timestamp will be returned.

401.description: Unauthorized, if the provided authorization token is not valid

404.description: Provided OCPI Token are not the same(count) with the existing ones, error code: 2912

500.description: Generic server error with status error code: 3000

post.description: The new created CDR is pushed from CPO to the eMSP.

401.description: Unauthorized, if the provided authorization token is not valid

404.description: OCPI Token does not exists with status error code: 2911

409.description: Conflict, CDR already exist with this cdr_id.

500.description: Generic server error with status error code: 3000

get.description:
Returns a list of all supported OCPI versions and the corresponding URLs
to where version specific details such as the supported endpoints can be found.

get.summary: Get all endpoints for a specific OCPI version.
get.description: This endpoint lists the supported endpoints and their URLs for a specific OCPI version.

404.description: Requested object not found

get.description: Fetch information about Tokens known in the eMSP system.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Only return Tokens that have last_updated after or equal to this Date/Time (inclusive)

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Only return Tokens that have last_updated up to this Date/Time, but not including (exclusive).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the first object returned. Default is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of objects to GET

401.description: Unauthorized, if the provided authorization token is not valid

404.description: Server no matching endpoints with status error code: 3003

500.description: Generic server error with status error code: 3000

get.description: Returns all tariffs with filters and pagination.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Only return Tariffs that have last_updated after or equal to this Date/Time (inclusive).

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Only return Tariffs that have last_updated up to this Date/Time, but not including (exclusive).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the first object returned. Default is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of objects to GET. Default is 100

401.description: Unauthorized, if the provided authorization token is not valid

404.description: Server no matching endpoints with status error code: 3003

500.description: Generic server error with status error code: 3000

get.description: Returns a list of charging locations (with EVSEs and Connectors) at a CPO.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Only return Locations that have last_updated after or equal to this Date/Time (inclusive)

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Only return Locations that have last_updated up to this Date/Time, but not including (exclusive).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the first object returned. Default is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of objects to GET

401.description: Unauthorized, if the provided authorization token is not valid

404.description: Server no matching endpoints with status error code: 3003

500.description: Generic server error with status error code: 3000

404.description: Charging Stations for the requested Location were not found.
EVSE with the provided EVSE_ID does not exist.
EVSE with the provided Connector_ID does not exist.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

data.description: Contains the actual response data object or list of objects from each request

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

supplier_name.description: Name of the energy supplier for this token.

contract_id.description: Contract ID at the energy supplier, that belongs to the owner of this token.

EnergyContract.description:
When the Charge Point supports using your own energy supplier/contract at a
Charge Point, information about the energy supplier/contract is needed so the
CPO knows which energy supplier to use.
NOTE: In a lot of countries it is currently not allowed/possible to use a drivers
own energy supplier/contract at a Charge Point.

type.description:
The type of token *

* NOTE: The eMSP is RECOMMENDED to push Tokens with type: AD_HOC_USER or APP_USER with whitelist set to * NEVER. Whitelists are very useful for RFID type Tokens, but the AD_HOC_USER/APP_USER Tokens are used to * start Sessions from an App etc. so whitelisting them has no advantages. *

issuer.description: Issuing company, most of the times the name of the company printed on the token (RFID card), not necessarily the eMSP.

whitelist.description: Indicates what type of white-listing is allowed.

language.description:
Language Code ISO 639-1. This optional field indicates the Token owners  preferred interface language.
If the language is not provided or not supported then the CPO is free to choose its own language.

uid.description:
Unique ID by which this Token can be identified.
This is the field used by CPO system (RFID reader on the Charge Point) to identify this token.
Currently, in most cases: type=RFID, this is the RFID hidden ID as read by the RFID reader, but that is not a requirement.
If this is a APP_USER or AD_HOC_USER Token, it will be a uniquely, by the eMSP, generated ID.
This field is named uid instead of id to prevent confusion with: contract_id.

country_code.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the MSP that 'owns' this Token.

party_id.description: CPO ID of the MSP that 'owns' this Token (following the ISO-15118 standard).

contract_id.description: Uniquely identifies the EV Driver contract token within the eMSPs platform (and suboperator platforms). Recommended to follow the specification for eMA ID from "eMI3 standard version V1.0" (http://emi3group.com/documents-links/)  "Part 2: business objects."

visual_number.description: Visual readable number/identification as printed on the Token (RFID card), might be equal to the contract_id.

group_id.description:
This ID groups a couple of tokens. This can be used to make two or more tokens work as one, so that a session can be started with one token and stopped with another, handy when a card and key-fob are given to the EV-driver.
 Beware that OCPP 1.5/1.6 only support group_ids (it is called parentId in OCPP 1.5/1.6) with a maximum length of 20.

default_profile_type.description:
The default Charging Preference. When this is provided, and a charging session
is started on an Charge Point that support Preference base Smart Charging and
support this ProfileType, the Charge Point can start using this ProfileType,
without this having to be set via: Set Charging Preferences.

last_updated.description: Timestamp when this Token was last updated (or created).

expiry_date.description: Timestamp when this Token expires in charging station's local authorization cache.

Token.description: Contains the actual response data object or list of objects from each request

interfaceRole.description: The interface role this endpoint implements
The interface role this url implements

website.description: Link to the operators website. An URL a string(255) type following the w3.org spec.

BusinessDetails.description: Information of the owner if available.

party_id.description: CPO, eMSP (or other role) ID of this party (following the ISO-15118 standard)

country_code.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the country this party is operating in.

role.description: The interface role this endpoint implements

url.description: URL from where the image data can be fetched through a web browser.

thumbnail.description: URL from where a thumbnail of the image can be fetched through a web browser.

category.description: Describes what the image is used for.

type.description: Image type, for example: gif, jpeg, png, svg

width.description: Width of the full scale image.

height.description: Height of the full scale image.

Image.description: Links to images related to the EVSE such as photos or logos.

token.description: The token for the other party to authenticate in your system.

url.description: The URL to your API versions endpoint.

party_id.description: CPO or eMSP ID of this party. (following the 15118 ISO standard).

country_code.description: Country code of the country this party is operating in.

latitude.description: Latitude of the point in decimal degree. Decimal separator: ".", Regex: -?[0-9]{1,2}\.[0-9]{5,7}

longitude.description: Longitude of the point in decimal degree. Decimal separator: ".", Regex: -?[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{5,7}

AdditionalGeoLocation.description: This class defines an additional geo location that is relevant for the Charge Point. The geodetic system to be used is WGS 84.

id.description: Identifier of the Connector within the EVSE. Two Connectors may have the same id as long as they do not belong to the same EVSE object.

standard.description: The standard of the installed connector.

format.description: The format (socket/cable) of the installed connector.

max_voltage.description: Maximum voltage of the connector (line to neutral for AC_3_PHASE), in volt [V]. For example: DC Chargers might vary the voltage during charging when battery almost full.

max_amperage.description: Maximum amperage of the connector, in ampere [A].

max_electric_power.description:
Maximum electric power that can be delivered by this connector, in Watts (W). When the maximum electric power is lower than the calculated value from voltage and amperage, this value should be set. 
    For example: A DC Charge Point which can delivers up to 920V and up to 400A can be limited to a maximum of 150kW (max_electric_power = 150000). Depending on the car, it may supply max voltage or current, but not both at the same time.
For AC Charge Points, the amount of phases used can also have influence on the maximum power.

tariff_ids.description:
Identifiers of the currently valid charging tariffs. Multiple tariffs are possible, but only one of each Tariff.type can be active at the same time. Tariffs with the same type are only allowed if they are not active at the same time: start_date_time and end_date_time period not overlapping.
    When preference-based smart charging is supported, one tariff for every possible ProfileType should be provided. These tell the user about the options they have at this Connector, and what the tariff is for every option.
For a "free of charge" tariff, this field should be set and point to a defined "free of charge" tariff.

items.description:
Identifiers of the currently valid charging tariffs. Multiple tariffs are possible, but only one of each Tariff.type can be active at the same time. Tariffs with the same type are only allowed if they are not active at the same time: start_date_time and end_date_time period not overlapping.
    When preference-based smart charging is supported, one tariff for every possible ProfileType should be provided. These tell the user about the options they have at this Connector, and what the tariff is for every option.
For a "free of charge" tariff, this field should be set and point to a defined "free of charge" tariff.

terms_and_conditions.description: URL to the operators terms and conditions.

last_updated.description: Timestamp when this Connector was last updated (or created).

Connector.description: A Connector is the socket or cable and plug available for the EV to use. A single EVSE may provide multiple Connectors but only one of them can be in use at the same time. A Connector always belongs to an EVSE object.

text.description: Text to be displayed to a end user. No markup, html etc. allowed.

DisplayText.description: List of multi-language alternative tariff info texts.

is_green_energy.description: True if 100% from regenerative sources. (CO2 and nuclear waste is zero)

energy_sources.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of energy sources of this locations tariff.

environ_impact.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of nuclear waste and CO2 exhaust of this locations tariff.

supplier_name.description: Name of the energy supplier, delivering the energy for this location or tariff.

energy_product_name.description: Name of the energy suppliers product/tariff plan used at this location.

EnergyMix.description: This type is used to specify the energy mix and environmental impact of the supplied energy at a location or in a tariff.

percentage.description: Percentage of this source (0-100) in the mix.

EnergySource.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of energy sources. All given values of all categories should add up to 100 percent.

amount.description: Amount of this portion in g/kWh.

EnvironmentalImpact.description: Amount of waste produced/emitted per kWh.

uid.description: Uniquely identifies the EVSE within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). For example a database ID or the actual "EVSE ID". This field can never be changed, modified or renamed. This is the 'technical' identification of the EVSE, not to be used as 'human readable' identification, use the field evse_id for that.This field is named uid instead of id, because id could be confused with evse_id which is an eMI3 defined field.

status.description: Indicates the current status of the EVSE.

capabilities.description: List of functionalities that the EVSE is capable of.

items.description: List of functionalities that the EVSE is capable of.

connectors.description: List of available connectors on the EVSE.

directions.description: Multi-language human-readable directions when more detailed information on how to reach the EVSE from the Location is required.

images.description: Links to images related to the EVSE such as photos or logos.

evse_id.description: Compliant with the following specification for EVSE ID from "eMI3 standard version V1.0" (http://emi3group.com/documents-links/) "Part 2: business objects." Optional because: if an evse_id is to be re-used in the real world, the evse_id can be removed from an EVSE object if the status is set to REMOVED.

status_schedule.description: Indicates a planned status update of the EVSE.

floor_level.description: Level on which the Charge Point is located (in garage buildings) in the locally displayed numbering scheme.

physical_reference.description: A number/string printed on the outside of the EVSE for visual identification.

parking_restrictions.description: The restrictions that apply to the parking spot.

items.description: The restrictions that apply to the parking spot.

last_updated.description: Timestamp when this EVSE or one of its Connectors was last updated (or created).

Evse.description: The EVSE object describes the part that controls the power supply to a single EV in a single session. It always belongs to a Location object. The object only contains directions to get from the location itself to the EVSE (i.e. floor, physical_reference or directions).

period_begin.description: Begin of the exception. SecurityScheme.In UTC, time_zone field can be used to convert to local time.

period_end.description: End of the exception. In UTC, time_zone field can be used to convert to local time.

ExceptionalPeriod.description: Specifies one exceptional period for opening or access hours.

latitude.description: Latitude of the point in decimal degree. Decimal separator: '.', Regex: -?[0-9]{1,2}\.[0-9]{5,7}

longitude.description: Longitude of the point in decimal degree. Decimal separator: '.' Regex: -?[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{5,7}

GeoLocation.description: This class defines the geo location of the Charge Point. The geodetic system to be used is WGS 84.

twentyfourseven.description: True to represent 24 hours a day and 7 days a week, except the given exceptions.

regular_hours.description: Regular hours, weekday-based. Only to be used if twentyfourseven=false, then this field needs to contain at least one RegularHours object.

exceptional_openings.description: Exceptions for specified calendar dates, time-range based. Periods the station is operating/accessible. Additional to regular_hours. May overlap regular rules.

exceptional_closings.description: Exceptions for specified calendar dates, time-range based. Periods the station is not operating/accessible. Overwriting regular_hours and exceptional_openings. Should not overlap exceptional_openings.

Hours.description: Opening and access hours of the location.

publish.description: Defines if a Location may be published on an website or app etc. When this is set to false, only tokens identified in the field: publish_allowed_to are allowed to be shown this Location. When the same location has EVSEs that may be published and may not be published, two 'Locations' should be created.

address.description: Street/block name and house number if available.

state.description: State or province of the location, only to be used when relevant.

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code for the country of this location.

directions.description: Human-readable directions on how to reach the location.

facilities.description: Optional list of facilities this charging location directly belongsmto.

items.description: Optional list of facilities this charging location directly belongsmto.

images.description: Links to images related to the location such as photos or logos.

country_code.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that 'owns' this Location.

party_id.description: ID of the CPO that 'owns' this Location (following the ISO-15118 standard).

id.description: Uniquely identifies the location within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). This field can never be changed, modified or renamed.

publish_allowed_to.description: This field may only be used when the publish field is set to false.Only owners of Tokens that match all the set fields of one PublishToken in the list are allowed to be shown this location.

postal_code.description: Postal code of the location, may only be omitted when the location has no postal code: in some countries charging locations at highways dont have postal codes.

related_locations.description: Geographical location of related points relevant to the user.

parking_type.description: The general type of parking at the charge point location.

evses.description: List of EVSEs that belong to this Location.

time_zone.description: One of IANA tzdatas TZ-values representing the time zone of the location. For example: "Europe/Oslo", "Europe/Zurich". (http://www.iana.org/time-zones)

charging_when_closed.description: Indicates if the EVSEs are still charging outside the opening hours of the location. E.g. when the parking garage closes its barriers over night, is it allowed to charge till the next morning? Default: true

last_updated.description: Timestamp when this Location or one of its EVSEs or Connectors were last updated (or created).

Location.description: The Location object describes the location and its properties where a group of EVSEs that belong together are installed. Typically, the Location object is the exact location of the group of EVSEs, but it can also be the entrance of a parking garage which contains these EVSEs. The exact way to reach each EVSE can be further specified by its own properties.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

uid.description: Unique ID by which this Token can be identified.

type.description:
The type of token *

* NOTE: The eMSP is RECOMMENDED to push Tokens with type: AD_HOC_USER or APP_USER with whitelist set to * NEVER. Whitelists are very useful for RFID type Tokens, but the AD_HOC_USER/APP_USER Tokens are used to * start Sessions from an App etc. so whitelisting them has no advantages. *

issuer.description: Issuing company, most of the times the name of the company printed on thetoken (RFID card), not necessarily the eMSP.

visual_number.description: Visual readable number/identification as printed on the Token (RFID card).

group_id.description: This ID groups a couple of tokens. This can be used to make two or more tokens work as one.

PublishTokenType.description: Defines the set of values that identify a token to which a Location might be published.At least one of the following fields SHALL be set: uid, visual_number, or group_id.When uid is set, type SHALL also be set.When visual_number is set, issuer SHALL also be set.

weekday.description: Number of day in the week, from Monday (1) till Sunday (7)

period_begin.description: Begin of the regular period, in local time, given in hours and minutes. Must be in 24h format with leading zeros. Example: "18:15". Hour/Minute separator: ":" Regex: ([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9].

period_end.description: End of the regular period, in local time, syntax as for period_begin. Must be later than period_begin.

RegularHours.description: Regular recurring operation or access hours.

status.description: Status value during the scheduled period.

period_end.description: End of the scheduled period, if known.

StatusSchedule.description: This type is used to schedule status periods in the future. The eMSP can provide this information to the EV user for trip planning purposes. A period MAY have no end. Example: "This station will be running as of tomorrow. Today it is still planned and under construction."

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

allowed.description: Status of the Token, and whether charging is allowed at the optionally given location.

authorization_reference.description:
Reference to the authorization given by the eMSP, when given, this
reference will be provided in the relevant Session and/or CDR.

AuthorizationInfo.description: Contains the actual response data object or list of objects from each request

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

evse_uids.description: Unique identifiers for EVSEs within the CPOs platform for the EVSE within the given location.

items.description: Unique identifiers for EVSEs within the CPOs platform for the EVSE within the given location.

LocationReferences.description:
Optional reference to the location if it was included in the request, and if
the EV driver is allowed to charge at that location. Only the EVSEs the
EV driver is allowed to charge at are returned.

customerUrlInfo.description: Customer info which holds info like url, module identifier and role interface

result.description: Result of the command request as sent by the Charge Point to the CPO.

message.description: Human-readable description of the reason (if one can be provided), multiple languages can be provided.

CommandResult.description:
Result of the command request, by the CPO (not the Charge Point). So this indicates if the CPO understood the command request and was able to send it to the Charge Point.
This is not the response by the Charge Point.

result.description: Response from the CPO on the command request.

timeout.description: Timeout for this command in seconds. When the Result is not received within this timeout, the eMSP can assume that the message might never be send.

message.description: Human-readable description of the result (if one can be provided), multiple languages can be provided.

CommandResponse.description:
Result of the command request, by the CPO (not the Charge Point). So this indicates if the CPO understood the command request and was able to send it to the Charge Point.
This is not the response by the Charge Point.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

url.description: URL to the endpoint containing version specific information

Version.description: This object contains the available OCPI version and the corresponding URL to where version specific details such as the supported endpoints can be found.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

endpoints.description: A list of supported endpoints for this version.

VersionDetails.description: Contains the actual response data object or list of objects from each request

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

Price.description: Total sum of all the cost related to a reservation of a Charge Point, including fixed price components, in the specified currency.

price.description: Price per unit (excl. VAT) for this tariff dimension.

vat.description: Applicable VAT percentage for this tariff dimension. If omitted, no VAT is applicable. Not providing a VAT is different from 0% VAT, which would be a value of 0.0 here.

step_size.description: Minimum amount to be billed. This unit will be billed in this step_size blocks. Amounts that are less then this step_size are rounded up to the given step_size. For example: if type is TIME and step_size has a value of 300, then time will be billed in blocks of 5 minutes. If 6 minutes were used, 10 minutes (2 blocks of step_size) will be billed.

PriceComponent.description: List of price components that describe the pricing of a tariff.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the tariff within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms).

currency.description: ISO-4217 code of the currency of this tariff.

type.description: Defines the type of the tariff. This allows for distinction in case of given Charging Preferences. When omitted, this tariff is valid for all sessions.

country_code.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that owns this Tariff.

party_id.description: CPO ID of the CPO that owns this Tariff (following the ISO-15118 standard).

tariff_alt_text.description: List of multi-language alternative tariff info texts.

tariff_alt_url.description: URL to a web page that contains an explanation of the tariff information in human readable form.

start_date_time.description: The time when this tariff becomes active, in UTC, time_zone field of the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used for a new tariff that is already given with the location, before it becomes active.

end_date_time.description: The time after which this tariff is no longer valid, in UTC, time_zone field if the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used when this tariff is going to be replaced with a different tariff in the near future.

last_updated.description: Timestamp when this Tariff was last updated (or created).

Tariff.description: A Tariff object consists of a list of one or more Tariff Elements, which can be used to create complex Tariff structures.

price_components.description: List of price components that describe the pricing of a tariff.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

reservation.description: When this field is present, the TariffElement describes reservation costs. A reservation starts when the reservation is made, and ends when the driver starts charging on the reserved EVSE/Location, or when the reservation expires. A reservation can only have: FLAT and TIME TariffDimensions, where TIME is for the duration of the reservation.

start_time.description: Start time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 13:30, valid from this time of the day. Must be in 24h format with leading zeros.Hour/Minute separator: ":" Regex: ([0-1][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]

end_time.description: End time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 19:45, valid until this time of the day. Same syntax as start_time. If end_time < start_time then the period wraps around to the next day. To stop at end of the day use: 00:00.

start_date.description: Start date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-24, valid from this day (inclusive).Regex: ([12][0-9]{3})-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])

end_date.description: End date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of theLocation, for example: 2015-12-27, valid until this day (exclusive).Same syntax as start_date.

min_kwh.description: Minimum consumed energy in kWh, for example 20, valid from this amount of energy (inclusive) being used.

max_kwh.description: Maximum consumed energy in kWh, for example 50, valid until this amount of energy (exclusive) being used.

min_current.description: Sum of the minimum current (in Amperes) over all phases, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than, or equal to, the defined amount of current, this TariffElement is/becomes active. If the charging current is or becomes lower, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the minimum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging current is above the defined value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging current drops below the defined value.

max_current.description: Sum of the maximum current (in Amperes) over all phases, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of current, this TariffElement becomes/is active. If the charging current is or becomes higher, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging current is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging current raises above the defined value.

min_power.description: Minimum power in kW, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than, or equal to, the defined amount of power, this TariffElement is/becomes active. If the charging power is or becomes lower, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the minimum power over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging power is above this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power drops below the defined value.

max_power.description: Maximum power in kW, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of power, this TariffElement becomes/is active. If the charging power is or becomes higher, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum power over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging power is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power raises above the defined value.

min_duration.description: Minimum duration in seconds the Charging Session MUST last (inclusive). When the duration of a Charging Session is longer than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. Before that moment, this TariffElement is not yet active.

max_duration.description: Maximum duration in seconds the Charging Session MUST last (exclusive). When the duration of a Charging Session is shorter than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. After that moment, this TariffElement is no longer active.

day_of_week.description: Which day(s) of the week this TariffElement is active.

items.description: Which day(s) of the week this TariffElement is active.

TariffRestrictions.description: These restrictions are not for the entire Charging Session. They only describe if and when a TariffElement becomes active or inactive during a Charging Session.

currency.description: Currency of the CDR in ISO 4217 Code.

tariffs.description: List of relevant Tariff Elements, see: Tariff. When relevant, a Free of Charge tariff should also be in this list, and point to a defined Free of Charge Tariff.

remark.description: Optional remark, can be used to provide additional human readable information to the CDR, for example: reason why a transaction was stopped.
remark.example: The cost of the electricity required to charge an EV is less than the cost to use petrol for a similar sized vehicle driving the same distance1. The cost will be lower if you charge your EV from your solar PV system or at free charging stations.

credit.description: When set to true, this is a Credit CDR, and the field credit_reference_id needs to be set as well.

country_code.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that 'owns' this CDR.

party_id.description: CPO ID of the CPO that 'owns' this CDR (following the ISO-15118 standard).

id.description: Uniquely identifies the CDR within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). This field is longer than the usual 36 characters to allow for credit CDRs to have something appended to the original ID. Normal (non-credit) CDRs SHALL only have an ID with a maximum length of 36.

start_date_time.description: Start timestamp of the charging session, or in-case of a reservation (before the start of a session) the start of the reservation.

end_date_time.description: The timestamp when the session was completed/finished, charging might have finished before the session ends, for example: EV is full, but parking cost also has to be paid.

session_id.description: Unique ID of the Session for which this CDR is sent. Is only allowed to be omitted when the CPO has not implemented the Sessions module or this CDR is the result of a reservation that never became a charging session, thus no OCPI Session.

authorization_reference.description: Reference to the authorization given by the eMSP. When the eMSP provided an authorization_reference in either: real-time authorization or StartSession, this field SHALL contain the same value. When different authorization_reference values have been given by the eMSP that are relevant to this Session, the last given value SHALL be used here.

meter_id.description: Identification of the Meter inside the Charge Point.

charging_periods.description: List of Charging Periods that make up this charging session. A session consists of 1 or more periods, where each period has a different relevant Tariff.

total_time.description: Total duration of the charging session (including the duration of charging and not charging), in hours.

total_parking_time.description: Total duration of the charging session where the EV was not charging (no energy was transferred between EVSE and EV), in hours.

invoice_reference_id.description: This field can be used to reference an invoice, that will later be send for this CDR. Making it easier to link a CDR to a given invoice. Maybe even group CDRs that will be on the same invoice.

credit_reference_id.description: Is required to be set for a Credit CDR. This SHALL contain the id of the CDR for which this is a Credit CDR.

home_charging_compensation.description: When set to true, this CDR is for a charging session using the home charger of the EV Driver for which the energy cost needs to be financially compensated to the EV Driver.

last_updated.description: Timestamp when this CDR was last updated (or created).

Cdr.description:
The CDR object describes the charging session and its costs, how these costs are composed, etc.
The CDR object is different from the Session object. The Session object is dynamic as it reflects the current state of the chargingsession. The information is meant to be viewed by the driver while the charging session is ongoing.

volume.description: Volume of the dimension consumed, measured according to the dimension type.

CdrDimension.description: List of relevant values for this charging period.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the location within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). This field can never be changed, modified or renamed.

address.description: Street/block name and house number if available.

state.description: State only to be used when relevant.

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code for the country of this location.

evse_uid.description: Uniquely identifies the EVSE within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). For example a database unique ID or the actual EVSE ID. This field  can never be changed, modified or renamed. This is the technical identification of the EVSE, not to be used as human readable identification, use the field: evse_id for that.

evse_id.description: Compliant with the following specification for EVSE ID from eMI3 standard version V1.0 (http://emi3group.com/documents-links/) Part 2: business objects.

connector_id.description: Identifier of the connector within the EVSE.

connector_standard.description: The standard of the installed connector.

connector_format.description: The format (socket/cable) of the installed connector.

CdrLocation.description: The CdrLocation class contains only the relevant information from the Location object that is needed in a CDR.

timestamp.description: The timestamp this message was generated

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging

uid.description: Unique ID by which this Token can be identified. This is the field used by the CPOs system (RFID reader on the Charge Point) to identify this token. Currently, in most cases: type=RFID, this is the RFID hidden ID as read by the RFID reader, but that is not a requirement. If this is a type=APP_USER Token, it will be a unique, by the eMSP, generated ID.

country_code.description: Country code of the MSP that 'owns' this Token.

party_id.description: ID of the eMSP that 'owns' this Token.

type.description:
The type of token *

* NOTE: The eMSP is RECOMMENDED to push Tokens with type: AD_HOC_USER or APP_USER with whitelist set to * NEVER. Whitelists are very useful for RFID type Tokens, but the AD_HOC_USER/APP_USER Tokens are used to * start Sessions from an App etc. so whitelisting them has no advantages. *

contract_id.description: Uniquely identifies the EV driver contract token within the eMSPs platform (and suboperator platforms). Recommended to follow the specification for eMA ID from eMI3 standard version V1.0 (http://emi3group.com/documents-links/) Part 2: business objects.

CdrToken.description: Token used to start this charging session, includes all the relevant information to identify the unique token.

dimensions.description: List of relevant values for this charging period.

start_date_time.description: Start timestamp of the charging period. A period ends when the next period starts. The last period ends when the session ends.

tariff_id.description: Unique identifier of the Tariff that is relevant for this Charging Period. If not provided, no Tariff is relevant during this period.

ChargingPeriod.description: A Charging Period consists of a start timestamp and a list of possible values that influence this period, for example: amount of energy charged this period, maximum current during this period etc.

url.description: URL that can be shown to an EV driver. This URL gives the EV driver the possibility to check the signed data from a charging session.

encoding_method.description: The name of the encoding used in the SignedData field. This is the name given to the encoding by a company or group of companies.

public_key.description: Public key used to sign the data, base64 encoded.
public_key.example:
-----BEGIN RSA PUBLIC KEY-----
MEgCQQCo9+BpMRYQ/dL3DS2CyJxRF+j6ctbT3/Qp84+KeFhnii7NT7fELilKUSnx
S30WAvQCCo2yU1orfgqr41mM70MBAgMBAAE=
-----END RSA PUBLIC KEY-----

SignedData.description: This class contains all the information of the signed data. Which encoding method is used, if needed, the public key and a list of signed values.

nature.description:
Nature of the value, in other words, the event this value belongs to.
Possible values at moment of writing: 
- Start (value at the start of the Session)
- End (signed value at the end of the Session)
- Intermediate (signed values take during the Session, after Start, before End)
Others might be added later.

plain_data.description: The unencoded string of data. The format of the content depends on the EncodingMethod field.

signed_data.description: Blob of signed data, base64 encoded. The format of the content depends on the EncodingMethod field.

SignedValue.description: This class contains the signed and the plain/unsigned data. By decoding the data, the receiver can check if the content has not been altered.
